>
[Ride](/Feats.aspx?ID=835) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="General" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=78" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 266 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

</column>

---

When you [Command an Animal](/Actions.aspx?ID=58) you’re mounted on to take a move action (such as Stride), you automatically succeed instead of needing to attempt a check. Any animal you’re mounted on acts on your turn, like a minion. If you Mount an animal in the middle of an encounter, it skips its next turn and then acts on your next turn.

<title level="2">Ride leads to...</title>
[Mammoth Lord Dedication](/Feats.aspx?ID=3443)
